alert.note: Alert for Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 14 at 7:40AM CDT until March 14 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS MONDAY AFTERNOON... .An approaching upper-level system coming from the northwest will strengthen north-northwest flow in the afternoon hours Monday. 20 ft winds will be 20 to 25 mph in the afternoon hours. Relative humidity will drop into the low teens across Hudspeth county. Dry conditions and breezy winds will lead to increased fire danger with the potential for erratic fire behavior. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 056... * WIND...Northwest winds 25 and 35 mph with gusts up to 40 mph * HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent * HIGHEST THREAT...is located in Hudspeth county * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
